newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Mirvac on way to higher year result.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Mirvac on way to higher year result.

text.p: Property developer and manager Mirvac Ltd said on Wednesday it was well on the way to achieving a significantly higher result for the current 1996/97 (July-June) year.

"The directors are confident that Mirvac is well on the way to achieving a significantly improved result over 1996 year-end," Mirvac Chairman Adrian Lane said in a statement announcing Mirvac's first half results.
Mirvac's net profit rose 17.6 percent to A$13.69 million for the six months to December 31.
Mirvac also increased its interim dividend to four cents per share from from three cents per share.
Total group revenue rose 10 percent ot A$193.6 million for the period, while pre-tax operating profit rose 14.1 percent to A$21.08 million.

"The major contributor to the group's profit was the improved performance of the property development division, driven by a strong result in residential building in particular," Mirvac Managing Director Robert Hamilton said in the profit statement.
Property development operating income rose five percent to A$150 million, while after tax profits rose 16 percent to A$10 million.
Revenue from Mirvac's hotel division rose seven percent to A$31 million, while after tax profit rose 21 percent.

"We will see further expansion for this division through the management rights of committed hotel and apartment hotel projects, with the expansion of Quay West, Marriott and Plaza brands totalling over 1,000 additional rooms," Hamilton said.
Mirvac's shares were unchanged at A$2.50 at 11.20 a.m. (0020 GMT).
